definitions.definition: An injury, such as a cut, stab, or tear, to a (usually external) part of the body.
A hurt to a person's feelings, reputation, prospects, etc.
definitions.example: It took a long time to get over the wound of that insult.

definitions.definition: An injury to a person by which the skin is divided or its continuity broken.
To hurt or injure (someone) by cutting, piercing, or tearing the skin.
definitions.example: The police officer wounded the suspect during the fight that ensued.
The actor's pride was wounded when the leading role went to his rival.
